message: What are everyone's favorite rails development blogs they follow?
+1 - and I'd be curious about podcasts too.
If you want more resources on Ruby or Rails, I've got a list of them on the wiki at https://github.com/yegrb/yeg-wiki/wiki/Ruby-resources.

http://rubyflow.com is handy to keep tabs on what's happening. It's a podcast, not a blog, but I also like http://thechangelog.com/ for in-depth interviews. They talk a lot about Ruby, but also JavaScript and other open source.
The official Rails blog is also handy for tracking official Rails releases and updates, http://weblog.rubyonrails.org/.
DailyJs is also handy for getting JavaScript news. http://dailyjs.com/
I like the ruby5, also a podcast. http://ruby5.envylabs.com/
The Plataformatec's blog is also good (devise guys) http://blog.plataformatec.com.br/
Oh, and the Intridea blog (omniauth guys, etc) http://intridea.com/blog
I love Thoughbot's blog http://robots.thoughtbot.com/. They usually get picked up in ruby5/rubyflow though. I also like "The Ruby Show" podcast http://rubyshow.com/
This one is totally awesome: http://blog.darkhax.com/ (lol I have no shame)
@darkhelmetlive +1, Daniel's blog is awesome. Don't let his modesty fool you.
